metadata.title: CVE-2018-10911 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the way dic_unserialize function of glusterfs does nothandle negative key length values. An attacker could use this flaw to readmemory from other locations into the stored dict value.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-10911` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

glusterfs-client - 4.1.4-1
glusterfs-common - 4.1.4-1
glusterfs-server - 4.1.4-1
libgfapi0 - 4.1.4-1
libgfchangelog0 - 4.1.4-1
libgfrpc0 - 4.1.4-1
libgfxdr0 - 4.1.4-1
libglusterfs0 - 4.1.4-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: glusterfs package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.1.4-1').
